parts.text: {"word":"cumulative","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"adjective","definition":"累積的な、累積する、漸増的な","english_definition":"increasing or increased in quantity, degree, or force by successive additions.","examples":[{"sentence":"The cumulative effect of these small changes is significant.","translation":"これらの小さな変化の累積的な効果は大きい。"},{"sentence":"Cumulative rainfall this month has exceeded the average.","translation":"今月の累積降水量は平均を超えた。"},{"sentence":"The cumulative impact of stress on health can be severe.","translation":"ストレスが健康に与える累積的な影響は深刻になる可能性がある。"}],"collocations":["cumulative effect (累積効果)","cumulative total (累積合計)","cumulative impact (累積的影響)","cumulative frequency (累積頻度)","cumulative distribution (累積分布)","cumulative learning (累積学習)"],"synonyms":["accumulative","increasing","aggregate","collective","growing","progressive"],"antonyms":["decreasing","diminishing","subtractive","individual","separate"]},{"part_of_speech":"adjective","definition":"(権利・特権などが)累積される、繰り越される","english_definition":"(of rights, dividends, etc.) accumulating; accruing over time if not exercised or paid out.","examples":[{"sentence":"The preferred stock has cumulative dividends.","translation":"その優先株には累積配当がある。"},{"sentence":"Unused vacation days are cumulative up to a certain limit.","translation":"未使用の有給休暇は、一定の制限まで累積される。"}],"collocations":["cumulative dividends (累積配当)","cumulative voting (累積投票)","cumulative preferred stock (累積優先株)"],"synonyms":["accruing","accumulating","building up","increasing over time"],"antonyms":["non-cumulative","non-accruing"]}],"etymology":{"value":"Late Middle English: from late Latin cumulativus, from cumulare ‘heap up’, from cumulus ‘a heap’.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˈkjuːmjələtɪv/","syllables":"cu-mu-la-tive"},"inflection":{"notes":"Adjective, so comparative and superlative forms are 'more cumulative' and 'most cumulative', respectively, although these are less common than using 'cumulative' directly."},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Cumulative' describes something that increases over time by adding to itself. It's often used to describe effects, totals, or impacts that build up gradually. In finance, it can refer to dividends or other rights that accumulate if not paid out or used. It is important to distinguish from simple 'additive' processes, as 'cumulative' implies a growing or intensifying effect.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ The cumulative of the scores was 100.","correct":"✓ The cumulative total of the scores was 100. / ✓ The cumulative score was 100.","note":"'Cumulative' is an adjective, so it needs to modify a noun. Use 'cumulative total' or 'cumulative score' instead of just 'cumulative'."},{"incorrect":"✗ The effect was very cumulative.","correct":"✓ The effect was very strong. / ✓ The cumulative effect was significant.","note":"While grammatically correct, 'very cumulative' is less common and often less impactful than using a stronger adjective to describe the effect itself or emphasizing the significance of the cumulative effect."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["cumulatively (adverb)","accumulation (noun)","accumulate (verb)"],"idioms_phrases":[],"priority":"★★☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"C1","frequency_google_ngram":"Moderately Frequent","priority":"★★☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"C1","text":"The word 'cumulative' is used to describe something that grows or increases over time by adding to itself. It's often used in academic or professional contexts to describe the combined effect of multiple actions or events. Understanding this word helps in comprehending complex processes and long-term impacts.","example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The **cumulative** damage from the earthquake was devastating.","translation":"地震による累積的な被害は壊滅的だった。","type":"adjective","meaning_category":"累積的な"},{"sentence":"We need to analyze the **cumulative** data to see the trends.","translation":"傾向を見るためには、累積データを分析する必要がある。","type":"adjective","meaning_category":"累積的な"},{"sentence":"The **cumulative** effect of exercise and diet is improved health.","translation":"運動と食事の累積的な効果は健康の改善である。","type":"adjective","meaning_category":"累積的な"}]}
